newsitem.title: ITALY: Salomon to chase more Italian business - Europe CEO.
newsitem.headline: Salomon to chase more Italian business - Europe CEO.

text.p: U.S. investment bank Salomon Brothers intends to chase more business in Italy following the establishment of an office in Milan, Peter Middleton, Salomon Europe's chief executive officer said on Wednesday.
"Some opportunities have passed us by because we did not have a local presence," Middleton told reporters.

Salomon has in recent months assembled a team of 17 people in Milan and recently moved the head of Italian fixed income customer trading to Italy, said Middleton. Salomon is now a primary dealer in the Italian government market.
Leonardo Pagni, the head of Salomon's Milan office, said the next objective was to expand investment banking in Italy.

"We are essentially dedicated to trading fixed income. We will develop the sales side of the business and related money market activities are very important," he said, adding the key idea was to move closer to clients.
"The next step will be in terms of investment banking in Europe," Pagni added. Middleton said Salomon was determined not to expand too quickly in continental Europe.
"You cannot let costs get too far ahead of your revenues," he said.
